did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Stanford University, Stanford Repertory Theatre, records
did.abstract: These records cover the whole period of SRT's operations and include correspondence, graphics, photographs, production books and scrapbooks of publicity clippings.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford University, Stanford Repertory Theatre, Records (SC0114). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Stanford Repertory Theatre (SRT) represented an attempt to establish a professional repertory theatre on the Stanford campus. Originally funded by the Rockefeller Foundation with a matching grant from the University, it was phased out at the end of the grant as an unsuccessful and expensive project.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: These records cover the whole period of SRT's operations and include correspondence, graphics, photographs, production books and scrapbooks of publicity clippings.

Box 1 Contains correspondence and records on various professional affiliations (ANTA, Ford Foundation), insurance policy transactions, mailing lists, ticket orders, box office reports and annual budgets for 1965 through 1969.
Box 2 Contains subscription reports and records, box office reports by individual production, and salary/tax/payroll personnel forms.

Box 3 Contains group ticket orders and sales records, mailing lists (groups, industrial groups, and individuals), newsletters, news releases, ticket information, correspondence with ticket agencies, and correspondence-transactions with Actors Equity.

scopecontent.p: Contains personnel files by individual employee, in alphabetical order. Actors' and actresses' files include professional resumes and photos (Head Shots).

Box 5 Files contain primarily correspondence about particular production, also business forms, records, and some advertising relating only to a particular production. Box 6 Files contain photographs (in print and contact sheet form) of individual productions.
